title: Engine API - new method `engine_createNewBlock`

### Description
As Rollup operator developers, we want to use Besu as an L2 chain execution engine, by leveraging the merge [execution API]. (https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/specification.md). 

For a rollup to be censorship-resistant, rollup operators need to be able to create a new block with a specific list of transactions, defined externally to the operator (e.g forced directly through L1). The Current [Execution API specification](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/specification.md) does not allow such functionality. Moreover, this functionality would be valuable to have because it would simplify block creation logic/flow in the Operator.

To support such functionality, `engine` api can be extended with a new  method with the following arguments:
- **parentRootHash** - hash of parent block, upon which new block should be created;
- **transactions** - list of transactions to be included in the block, in the specified order;
- **suggestedFeeRecipient** - recipient of the transaction fees;
- **blockGasLimit** - limit of gas to process the transactions;
- **skipInvalidTransactions** - if true, when an invalid transaction (e.g nonce) is in the `transactions` list, the execution engine should  skip it and carry on processing the remaining transactions;
   - invalid transactions should be reported the why not executed/reverted because the operator needs to justify why the transaction cannot be executed.

### Method: `engine_createNewBlock`
Extend engine API with a new method, e.g `engine_createNewBlock` (or any other name more suitable and semantically correct. engine_processNewBlock?)

### Request
```
engine_createNewBlock(
   parentRootHash: 0xAF01..., 
   transactions=[], 
   suggestedFeeRecipient = 0xBF01..., 
   blockGasLimit=..., 
   skipInvalidTransactions=false
)
```

### Response
- result: `Object`
    -  status: `Object`
       - `INVALID_TERMINAL_BLOCK` - when `parentRootHash` does not exist;
       - `INVALID_TRANSACTIONS` - when a transaction is invalid and `skipInvalidTransactions` is false;
       - `BLOCK_GAS_LIMIT_EXCEEDED` - when the processing of `transactions` exceeds `blockGasLimit`;
       - `PROCESSED` - when block was successfully processed;
  - `executionPayloadV1`: `Object` - defined when `status = PROCESSED` as in [ExecutionPayloadV1](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/specification.md#ExecutionPayloadV1)
  - `failedTransactions`: `Array of Data` - list of receipts of failed transactions. Defined when `status = PROCESSED, skipInvalidTransactions = true`
- error: `Object` - `code` and `message` set in case an exception happens while processing the request.

### Specification
1. Engine looks for the block with `parentRootHash`, if not present returns failure status `INVALID_BLOCK_HASH`
2. Engine process a new block in the given list of `transactions` in the given order. 
2.1. Engine validates that block does exceed `blockGasLimit`. The engine may return `BLOCK_GAS_LIMIT_EXCEEDED` as soon as it checks that `blockGasLimit` is exceeded;
2.2. Invalid transactions: 
- `skipInvalidTransactions = false` the block processing is aborted and returns with `INVALID_TRANSACTIONS` status;
- `skipInvalidTransactions = true` engine discards the current transaction and continues to process the remaining transactions until it finishes.
3. Engine responds to the call when successful with 
  - ```{ result: status = PROCESSED, executionPayloadV1:  ExecutionPayloadV1, failedTransactions: [...]}```
`engine_createNewBlock`'s `includeInCanonicalChain` argument is not necessary as there is no guarantee that the block will be validated/finalised in L1.
